Retirement Benefits - Supplement
At the time Harry J. Skomia (President) and Harold E. Hill (Administrative
Vice President) were employed, the entire Headquarters staff was considered
a part of the University of Illinois and all members of the staff were
thus participants in the University Retirement System.
Since participation in the Retirement System was considered to be an
additional inducement to remain with the HAEB, so far as the President
and Administrative Vice President were concerned, the NAEB Board of DirecÂ¬
tors decided that, when the Headquarters operation was removed from the
jurisdiction of the University of Illinois, retirement benefits, in cash,
should be paid to Messrs. Skomia and Hill at a rate equivalent to the
contribution paid for them into the Retirement System by the HAEB. This
increment amounts to 8.477$ of the base salary paid to each of these men.
